revised_title: Capillary Phenomena in Rotationally Symmetric Fluid Bodies with One Asymptote - Holms
tldr: The authors study capillary phenomena in rotationally symmetric fluid bodies with one asymptote, called holms. They describe the properties of these holms and their applications in interfacial tension determination, stability criteria for floating objects, and wetting of solids by fluid sheets. The authors also discuss the behavior of holms meeting rods and spheres, and the detachment of rods from the interface. They provide numerical solutions for meridian curves and tabulate characteristic quantities for different cases.
